title: What good universities do not require SAT subject tests? - Quora

response.answer_text: The key to your question is in the “good” requirement. Without knowing what qualifies as good for you, it’s very difficult to answer this question. Are you talking about the 100 or so schools everyone knows? The Ivies, Stanford, MIT, etc.? The “little Ivies”? Or are you looking at something else. Dig past the brand names, and you’ll still find plenty of “good” universities, and almost none of them require SAT subject tests. The SAT subject tests are becoming less important for most universities. Yes, the universities considered “elite”, the “brands” so to speak, will still ask for subject tests. One important thing to keep in mind is the “optional” statement some schools will use. If the university’s application says the subject tests are “optional” or “recommended”, you’re going to need to do them. In the college application process, “optional” doesn’t really apply to the applicant.
